intro: Acmadenia tetracarpellata, commonly known as the four-ovary acmadenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with simple, opposite leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its reproductive strategy in its native habitat.
